items.title: Hotel Review: Blique by Nobis, Stockholm
items.abstract: A hotel takes inspiration from its neighbors in the city’s gallery district. Just be judicious with the small talk!

items.title: Preindustrial Design Meets Politics
items.abstract: A retrospective of Studio Formafantasma opens at the Stedelijk Museum’s-Hertogenbosch in the Netherlands.

items.title: The Mixed Message of Earth-Friendly Design
items.abstract: “Broken Nature” at MoMA offers up a trove of ‘restorative’ projects. Does buying more elegant objects help heal the planet?

items.title: A New Design Shop That Aims to Elevate the Smoke-Filled Room
items.abstract: Tetra, a lifestyle brand dreamed up by three friends and T contributors, sources and sells unique objects created to heighten the aesthetics of smoking.

items.title: Inside T’s Design Issue
items.abstract: Our latest issue looks backward to the aesthetics of the hedonistic ’70s and oddly alluring po-mo ’80s.
